intro: Oplonia nannophylla, commonly known as the small-leaf oplonia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to tropical regions of South America, this plant thrives in humid, shady environments. The fruit is a small, round berry that turns red when mature, containing several seeds. It is often found growing in dense undergrowth along riverbanks and in secondary forests.
